body.p: Transformer taps compensate for variation in incoming voltage from the nominal value. Voltage compensation taps on the transformer primary let you adjust the turns ratio, providing a constant value of secondary voltage to the load.

The transformer nameplate () is located near the transformer () and includes cable connections for voltage compensation taps with the resulting input voltage along with other transformer specifications.
Voltage compensation taps are changed from the front of the PDU ().

Voltage compensation taps are not available with transformers above 750 kVA or with the Multi-Output PDU Option. Transformer Voltage Compensation Taps and Main Circuit Breaker
